reviews.user_review: Apr 2025: great ambience and lovely place for a mid size group gathering. Wide selection of food within the menu for all tastes and preferences. We had the steak and fries + crab meat vermicelli dish. Both were v good. Of mention is the bun that came with the steak. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Wonderful!

Beautiful ambiance, decent food

The ambiance at Ngon Restaurant is absolutely beautiful ‚Äî such a charming and well-designed space that really elevates the dining experience. Perfect spot if you‚Äôre looking to enjoy a nice atmosphere while in Ho Chi Minh.

Food-wise, it was okay. Nothing bad, but not particularly memorable either. Still, worth a visit if you appreciate a great setting and a relaxed vibe.

Disappointing restaurant. Looks charming and filled with tourists. But service staff is rude and rushed. Food is really mediocre. Can you imagine a dish with French fries added to prawns pancake? And fried squid that tasted like fried eraser - good hard work for the jaws. Menu is super extensive‚Ä¶ too extensive. Maybe they should focus on getting a few dishes done really well instead

reviews.user_review: First off, you are paying for the location and the setting here. It's almost opposite the palace and has a huge menu spanning over 40 pages, how much choice is too much? It's great if you're in a group, maybe not so good as a solo traveler. I got combo number 2, a Vietnamese coffee and crab meat soup for 304,000k. I enjoyed every single one of the dishes, 5 different appetisers and they all tasted good. The crab meat soup was thick like "geng Áæπ" in Chinese cuisine and was loaded with crab. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this restaurant, the food was good and I liked the setting.

What a gorgeous restaurant, more like a big family restaurant. The aunties are cooking next to the diners, such a wholesome sight to see. Whilst devouring the array of amazing fresh Vietnamese dishes I am in awe of the architecture and maintenance of the space. I would definitely recommend this gem to my friends and family!

If you get here early, about 17:30, you can get a table right at the front on the ground floor.
I went twice during my stay and must say that each and every dish was wonderfully delicious,  authentic,  well presented, and value for money considering the location and ambience.
The beers are a little expensive compared to most places,  but the standard of the delicious food and the setting make it well worthwhile. The giveaway is that locals love this spot,  and if I am ever in Saigon again I will most definitely go again.

reviews.user_review:
Went there twice within two weeks. It's the perfect place to bring visitors. Without being exceptional, the food is varied and well-made. The place is pretty and cozy. It's very well decorated a bit like an old colonial house. The service was ok.

My only gripe is the price. The value is not there. Not that is bad, but I expect more impressive food for the price. But I would come back though.

Everything we ordered hit the table like a flavor bomb‚Äîbold, amazing flavors in every bite! The Vietnamese prawn pancakes were the only miss here (not recommended), too bland compared to everything else we tried. Still, we were too hooked on the standout dishes to mind much.

Our waitress was a champ, patient and on point with our big group. The jasmine IPA from a local brewery was sensational. Highly recommend this spot! üòçüëåüèº

I arrived at 11 and wanted to go to the cool place on the 2nd floor, but the staff told me that the 2nd floor opens at 11:30. However, customers who came in after 11:10 were guided to the 2nd floor. I didn't feel good. The staff was rude and the salad had a strong pork smell. The garlic fried rice also smelled weird. It seems that the taste has changed a lot from before. I won't visit again.

reviews.user_review: Nice decorations, good service and authentic and delicious food. I went alone so I ordered one Mi Quang, big portion serving with a very fresh and tasty vegetable basket. I were more than full so I couldn‚Äôt order more. I love the sauce and green chili. Good job üëè Congrats Muoi Kho.
We celebrated my husband‚Äôs birthday dinner here! The food is awesome! The price is very affordable! The staff were singing happy birthday too! Cute! They were nice too!

Food portion is huge!!! I recommend to order one by one if you are not sure about the portion.
The jackfruit salad and the noodle is amazing!!

reviews.user_review: Fine dinning Viet fusion food in Tran Nhat Duat street D1. Every dish is well thought over and cooked to perfection, omg tasted amazing!!!!! Everything well balanced wth a bit of tang and the sweet zestiness. Cocktails decorated beautiful. Nice restaurant and staff are very friendly.
Appetizers were good, but the Calamari was a bit 'chewy'. Seafood linguine was very tasty and surprisingly spicy. Service was excellent, and overall experience was pleasing.
Very nice and cozy atmosphere. The food is generally good but I think western style dishes are better than Vietnamese ones.

address: 140 ƒê. L√™ Th√°nh T√¥n, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: A family restaurant for at least 50 year old, they famous with glass noodle chicken soup and now they have more than 30 Vietnamese dishes, snacks and dessert, very delicious. Quick service, great location, on the street behind Ben Thanh market. Decent price, small restaurant.

This restaurant is a classic tourist trap, even the locals avoid it. The food quality is far below Vietnam‚Äôs usual standards of fresh ingredients. A great restaurant focuses on a few signature dishes, but this place tries to offer everything with an overwhelming menu of 1,000 items. The b√∫n m·∫Øm had an off-putting taste, and I suspect the fish wasn‚Äôt fresh. On top of that, the prices are outrageously high, at least double or triple what you‚Äôd normally pay. Definitely not worth it. Many other good options in the area. Try the alley way 10 meters to the left of the restaurant. Many good restaurants in the hidden gem alley.

We went here for the op la bo bahn mi since it is unique that you‚Äôll put the beef to spread ina bread. The taste was so so and we tried other dishes. The picture seems to be from google and we ordered one dish that doesn‚Äôt match the picture so be careful on this (we thought it was French fries but it was a noodle) haha they have comfort room or toilet to stopped by. This is just very near Ben Thanh market.

address: 106 S∆∞∆°ng Nguy·ªát Anh, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
This is one of the older Vietnamese seafood restaurant that tries to make having a dinner a grand affair. While there are many other cheaper and more casual seafood restaurant, this place is more for people who wants a more formal restaurant to celebrate an event or impress clients.

Food wise, I must say, is pretty good. All the dishes I had were delicious and definitely slightly above what you may eat elsewhere.

They have alot of service staff and hence, service is good and pormpt. They also have a live Filipino singer belting our popular English songs. Can be quite loud and distracting at times but does add to the overall atmosphere of the place.

Price wise, as I understand, is reasonable for the place and not over priced. But it's not a cheap cheap place as there are many more casual seafood restaurants elsewhere.

This is the fanciest place we‚Äôve been so far in HCM.  The service was impeccable.  They served each dish to each person individually.  We sat upstairs where there was a live piano singer.  He sang happy birthday to 2 tables.

The seafood eggrolls were amazing. I was not a big fan of the soft shell caravan or the shrimp that you have to peel. The seafood hot pot was really good too.
This place is a great gem. Great food, great music live and very friendly service staffs. Everything is tasty. From fish, hotpot, salad, squid, crabs, lobster...

reviews.user_review:
We dined at the Sol in district 7 and the venue is gorgeous. Food was delicious, well portioned and presented beautifully. We had the beef cheek, lamb and tuna ceviche and all were delicious.
I celebrated my 40th here and they were kind to offer icecream and shots (alcoholic and non-alcoholic) for dessert.
The pan cookie was 100% delicious!
I would highly recommend visiting for a nice ambient meal!

Another lucky shot to have entered this restaurant spontaneously.
All was great: food, staff and location and certainly worth the exceptional price. Best of the amazing food on the table was the seafood platter: Yes it is ‚Äújust regular seafood‚Äù on there, but combined with such delicately savory additions that it beast any other such I had on other continents.

The atmosphere by the pool is second to none.

The food was amazing. The beef was not only falling apart easily, but tasted so delicious too.

My wife has liked her Mexican rice and beef.

The portions were generous. We couldn't finish our food. If you are not a big eater, 1 main and 1 side would do for 2.

The washroom is one of the best, I came across in Vietnam.

The staff couldn't be more attentive. We had the pleasure to have Nathan as our waiter. He is a credit for the place.

reviews.user_review:
Overall great place for a date or special occasion, but food leaves something to be desired.

The atmosphere is quite pleasant. You arrive by boat and enter the restaurant through another restaurant. All the tables and chairs are adorned with nice LED lights, enhancing the ambiance. We ordered one of the set menus. The salad was definitely the highlight of the meal. The soup was pretty good, but the two main courses left something to be desired. The pasta noodles were enjoyable, but the sauce was overly strong, and the shrimp was overcooked. We also had the duck, which had good flavor but was far too dry. The scallop was quite good‚ÄîI really enjoyed its texture; it wasn‚Äôt soft but had a pleasant chewiness. The steak was decent with good flavor, though it was too chewy. The grits served with the steak were interesting, somewhat like a localized version of grits. The best part of the steak dish was the roasted garlic‚Äîit was some of the best I‚Äôve ever had. Its consistency was perfect, and the flavor wasn‚Äôt overpowering; I could‚Äôve eaten the whole bulb myself. For dessert, we had the cheesecake and molten lava cake. The molten lava cake was just okay and not very molten‚Äîit would‚Äôve been much better with vanilla ice cream on the side. The so-called New York-style cheesecake was neither New York-style, nor cheesecake, nor even a cake. It was more like a cookie crumble topped with sweet cream and a layer of pistachios or nuts. The taste was decent, but if you‚Äôre expecting cheesecake, it‚Äôs nowhere close. It should be renamed to something else. We were also given a call server button to request service, but it didn‚Äôt work at all. When we pointed this out, they didn‚Äôt bother replacing it.
Absolutely love the vibes here! The food is outstanding, and the service is top-notch. Th√°i is an amazing server, and Trung takes the best photos. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!
Booked a table for two for our 1 year anniversary. The food was exquisite. Even though the menu was unique, I could tell the chef maintained the taste of Vietnam. Definitely worth the experience.

It was a good experience at this restaurant! We had a chill weekday dinner with the kids, who enjoyed watching the trains go by and deliver food. The food was pretty decent overall and it covers a wide variety of cuisines. The owner is very friendly too!

reviews.user_review: This is a grand Chinese restaurant with upscale decor, located next to Crescent Mall. I had lunch here around 12:15 pm, and surprisingly, ours was the only occupied table. They serve dim sum, pork belly, and roasted duck. While the prices are reasonable given the elegant ambiance, the food fell a bit short of my expectations‚Äîthough, admittedly, I may have set the bar quite high.

Shang Garden is a wonderful Chinese restaurant that doesn't disappoint. Located right next to Crescent Mall, this restaurant offers a variety of delicious, authentic cuisine. The restaurant is very spacious and is decorated very elegantly.

Their dim sum is excellent and the duck is incredible. We usually order a variety of dishes which are affordable and plenty to go around if you have a big group of friends or family. From Stir Fried Rice and Noodles to Won Ton soup to Sweet and Sour Pork you name it they got it.

reviews.user_review: I recently visited an Indian restaurant in District 7, and I must say, it was a delightful experience! The quality of the food was outstanding, the prices were reasonable, and the portion sizes were perfect ‚Äì enough for two people to share. The taste truly felt authentic, capturing the essence of real Indian cuisine. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, which added to the overall charm of the place. Despite having read some mixed comments before, I believe this spot is a must-visit. I‚Äôm already looking forward to coming back with friends!"

The only saving grace of this restaurant is the opportunity to dine outside in the sweltering midsummer heat of Ho Chi Minh City. Being completely alfresco, it‚Äôs not the place for those who prefer air-conditioned spaces.

Regarding the food, I think I‚Äôve found the worst Indian restaurant in all of Vietnam‚Äîworse even than some diners in Da Nang, which is quite an achievement. This place uses the same tricks: everything is pre-prepared, and they rely heavily on a single sauce. Ordering a garlic naan gets you a regular naan with garlic sprinkled on top, and a chili naan is just naan bread with cayenne pepper. It's infuriating.

I came here to enjoy Indian food but left shaking my head. The chole bhature, my staple favorite, was barely edible. The bhatura bread crumbled into nothing at the slightest touch, and the mutton was equally disappointing.

Overall, this restaurant is an embarrassment. I'm embarrassed to have dined here and that they can serve such food and charge money with a straight face.

Most of their business appears to come from delivery, so this review might not reach many potential customers. Despite scoring two stars (one star would imply malicious intent to ruin my meal), this restaurant is far from redeemable. I will certainly avoid this place for as long as I‚Äôm on this planet and suggest you do the same.
For Saigon, this is good. Good spice level and authentic flavours. It‚Äôs local to me and will definitely be back.

reviews.user_review: El Gaucho Argentinian Steakhouse is well-regarded for its focus on high-quality steaks and a refined dining experience. The steak at El Gaucho is often highlighted as a standout feature. The quality and flavor of the meat is premium, noting that the steaks are well-seasoned, cooked to perfection, and offer a true taste of Argentinian beef. Popular cuts like the ribeye and sirloin receive particular acclaim for their tenderness and rich taste. However, some customers feel that the steaks, while good, might not justify the high price point compared to other steakhouses. The ambiance of the restaurant is usually sophisticated and upscale, with a comfortable and stylish setting that‚Äôs suitable for both special occasions and business dinners. The decor is elegant, with a warm, inviting atmosphere. The staff is knowledgeable about the menu and able to offer good recommendations. That said, there have been occasional mentions of slower service during busy times or when the restaurant is fully booked. The menu offers a variety of steak cuts, along with classic sides and some Argentinian specialties. While the focus is clearly on the meat, the sides and appetizers are considered good but not exceptional. Some diners think that the side dishes could be more creative or varied to complement the high-quality steaks better. Pricing is on the higher side, reflecting the premium quality of the ingredients and the upscale dining environment. While many customers feel the price is justified by the quality of the steak and the overall experience, others feel it‚Äôs a bit steep for what‚Äôs offered. Overall, El Gaucho Argentinian Steakhouse delivers a strong steakhouse experience with high-quality meat, a refined atmosphere, and attentive service. While it might be a bit pricey, it‚Äôs a solid choice for those looking to enjoy a great steak in an elegant setting.

The atmosphere is relaxed and ideal to enjoy dinner. Music is played at a subdued volume. Not too loud like other places. English-speaking waiters helped a lot! Fast and efficient service.

reviews.user_review: The food was quite good. Delicious with reasonable price. The waitress who named Blink can speak fluent English and her service is professional. We enjoyed our time there. Would definitely go again!

I had an amazing dining experience at Home Saigon! Four of us ate here, and every dish was delicious and beautifully presented. The ambiance is warm and inviting, making it a perfect spot to enjoy authentic Vietnamese cuisine.

Our server, Tom, was fantastic‚Äîattentive, friendly, and knowledgeable about the menu. I have a peanut allergy, and he went above and beyond to ensure I had safe and equally delicious options, offering great suggestions and double-checking with the kitchen. It made such a difference to feel so accommodated and cared for.

Highly recommend this place for both the food and the excellent service. If you‚Äôre in Ho Chi Minh City, Home Saigon is a must-visit!

Home Saigon is definitely worth trying. The spring rolls were crispy, the grilled chicken with coconut rice was juicy and tender, and the pan-seared buffalo with flaming cointreau liqueur was rich, smoky, and perfectly seasoned. Both the service and atmosphere were also excellent.

reviews.user_review: Just excellent. Staff were great, not over-friendly, efficient, smiling but then let you get on with your evening. Menu was rolls, rice, soup, noodles and some roast meats, not extensive but certainly wide enough. Drinks selection decent. Presentation/visuals excellent (food and decor), prices very reasonable. Location reasonably central. Very much approved

Food is pretty decent - a tad of a modern Vietnamese. Try their crispy rice and propaganda salad. Place fills up quickly in the evening. Largely expat crowd. Price point is good for the quality of food. Super chill atmosphere.  Recommended

Great flavours in a bustling, air-conditioned environment. Had the roast chicken with broken rice alongside fried fishcake, and both were great. Reasonable prices and excellent service too. This is the place to go after wandering about the city centre. The absence of hordes of bus-ferried tour groups here is an amazing plus too. Come here before that changes.

reviews.user_review:
Secret Garden is a hidden gem in the heart of Saigon that combines traditional Vietnamese charm with a serene rooftop dining experience. Nestled above the bustling streets, the restaurant offers a peaceful escape and an authentic culinary journey.

The ambiance is enchanting, with lanterns, lush greenery, and rustic decor that create a cozy, intimate setting. It truly feels like dining in a charming Vietnamese garden. The rooftop view, though not expansive, provides a unique perspective of the city, especially during the evening when the lights come alive.

The food is the highlight of the experience. Every dish we tried was bursting with authentic flavors and made with fresh, high-quality ingredients. Their clay pot dishes, spring rolls, and banana flower salad were particularly outstanding. The presentation was thoughtful, and the portions were generous.

The staff was warm, attentive, and eager to recommend dishes to suit our tastes. Their genuine hospitality made the experience even more memorable.

Secret Garden is perfect for anyone looking to savor traditional Vietnamese cuisine in a tranquil and aesthetically pleasing setting. Whether you're a tourist exploring the city or a local seeking a special dining spot, this rooftop restaurant is a must-visit. We will definitely be back!

The restaurant is quite well hidden and needs to climb 4 levels to reach. But once you reach, it‚Äôs a food paradise with pretty lanterns and vibes. We ordered 2 gin-based cocktails - Ms Saigon and Saigon Summer, which are both great, esp Ms Saigon love it. Food wise everything we ordered was delicious and homely, especially love the eggplant and braised chicken with lime leaves. Will definitely come back again in the future when we visit HCMC.

The ambiance is pleasant, but the place is clearly geared toward tourists. The food was okay not bad, but not what you‚Äôd really hope for when dining in Vietnam. It felt more like being in a gentrified European city than in Saigon. Overall, not a terrible experience, but there are definitely better and more authentic places to eat in the city.

restaurant_name: Bep Me In - Nguyen Thai Binh
address: 165/50 ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh, Ph∆∞·ªùng Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review: This was the best tasting food that I've eaten at during my trip to Vietnam.  I liked it so much that I came back 2 other times, and brought a friend the second time.  My first experience at this place, I ordered the Beef Skewers with Rice Vermicelli and an order Fried Spring Rolls and Pickled Plum Juice.  These were all recommended by my waiter, and I gave everything a 10/10, and the portions were huge and I completely devoured it.  The second time I ordered the recommended Stir-Fried Beef Fillet with Beef Sauce and Vegetable and Salted Lemon Drink and didn't like it as much, as it didn't taste as good and the portion was a lot smaller.  The waiter also forgot the Spring rolls we ordered.  The place seems to have a lot of foreigners (which is often a red flag for me), and it does seem a bit commercial (it is a franchise), so I questioned its authenticity as Vietnamese cuisine.  However, despite all this, I still highly recommend this place as it's still my go-to when I want a full hearty and tasty meal that seems reasonably authentic.  It also seems like a good place to bring a date.

The service was fast. Although poor signal for card payment but the servers were always smiling and polite.

Food was served fast and hot. We love the skewers and pancakes. Really filling to the tummy. The servings were really good for sharing.

The ambiance is very soothing to the mood.

Our hotel recommended this place for food & I am so happy they did. The food was so delicious. They had meat options & vegetarian. I really enjoyed my milk coffee too. You can tell a lot of effort has been made into the quality of the service & the food. Get yourself down here you won't be disappointed!

reviews.user_review: Really good food. There were so many good options on the menu I‚Äôd have to come back 5-6 times just to do a review justice! With my one visit I can tell you the food is excellently cooked, authentic, appropriately priced and offered with good service. The snacks and meat plates are decidedly better than the noodle based dishes but I‚Äôm splitting hairs.

Went for dinner on a Sunday night. It was busy, recommend a res. I was seated quickly. The staff are friendly and helpful but inattentive. I ordered the pork and shrimp banh xeo. It's large and amply filled. There were only a few pieces of shrimp, however. It tasted great. I wasn't given cutlery, and the napkin holder was empty. I tried to get the server's attention but gave up. The adjoining table hunted down napkins, which instigated a panic among the staff. Eventually, someone brought me a knife to cut the banh xeo. May return to try other menu items. Paid with a card. They don't accept AmEx.

reviews.user_review:
Pok√© Saigon is an absolute gem! Their poke bowls are amazing‚Äîsuper fresh, packed with flavour, and loaded with a wide variety of ingredients to choose from. Whether you prefer classic salmon or something more adventurous, there‚Äôs something for everyone. The portions are generous, and the prices are surprisingly affordable for the quality you get.

The staff are incredibly friendly and welcoming, making the experience even better. The atmosphere is lovely, with a relaxed and modern vibe that‚Äôs perfect for a quick lunch or a casual dinner. If you‚Äôre in Saigon and craving something fresh and delicious, this is definitely the place to go!

Came here after a long bus journey and the bowl was super good. There was a large selection of toppings and poke. The servers were also super sweet and helpful when deciding what to get and checking up on us. Overall super delicious and a large portion too

reviews.user_review: Our tour guide Khang brought us to this wonderful restaurant for lunch. Everything was delicious, especially the fish dish. After lunch we had the egg coffee. Another delicious surprise.  Our server was darling and spoke perfect English. A great experience all around ‚ù§Ô∏è

Great hidden gem. The kid that took our order was very sassy but his English was pretty good. He was a funny guy. The pork skewers were amazing. I would go back for them. The dishes portions were a little small for me. But it's a good place for a snack. Good tasting meals.

reviews.user_review:
Everything we ordered hit the table like a flavor bomb‚Äîbold, amazing flavors in every bite! The Vietnamese prawn pancakes were the only miss here (not recommended), too bland compared to everything else we tried. Still, we were too hooked on the standout dishes to mind much.

Our waitress was a champ, patient and on point with our big group. The jasmine IPA from a local brewery was sensational. Highly recommend this spot! üòçüëåüèº

The fried half chicken was nothing special just as you expect fried chicken with not much seasoning. The beef with vegetables and the fried rice with garlic and egg were delicious! Not sure if worth the price we paid here. They have 5% service charge and 8% VAT too. Good overall but won‚Äôt come back. Other places much better!

This restaurant is an experience in many ways. Every dish we ordered was full of amazing flavours and we paired them with fresh juices. The restaurant creates a special vibe and atmosphere with love to details. Must go to place for an authentic Vietnamese food experience.

reviews.user_review: Probably the best fancy-style restaurant I‚Äôve been to in Ho Chi Minh, the food was really good and plenty of standout options. Loads on the menu I‚Äôd come back for. Service was a little slow but it was very busy. The prices were quite high for the City but not high for the quality of what you get. I‚Äôd highly recommend the mini-pancakes with oysters (so much better than the huge pancakes you get in other Michelin places in the city). The soft-shell crabs were the best I‚Äôve had, the legs come off perfectly and the dipping sauce is excellent. The netted spring rolls, pineapple rice were quite average. The chicken was top notch.

The food was good but definitely a lot more expensive than other places in HCM. You are paying for the ambiance, service and that they‚Äôre Michelin recommended. We tried the dishes recommended on the site and they were good. Nothing to die for. They provide a bowl of shrimp crackers as a light snack when you sit down. The most surprising thing is their egg coffee. We weren‚Äôt expecting anything too special and didn‚Äôt take a photo. Hands down the best one we had in town!

This is absolutely a delight and it made my day by their very well trained and well mannered staff. We ordered quite a few contemporary Vietnam dishes with non traditional but authentic flavors. I like the soft-shell crab and the taco like appetizer. The pork neck meat and the lemon grass chicken are really special. Price is also very reasonable with a Michelin label.   I certainly will bring my wife back here next time in town. P.S. a meal won‚Äôt be complete without a good dessert and coffee. For that, egg coffee is a must!

reviews.user_review: Apr 2025: great ambience and lovely place for a mid size group gathering. Wide selection of food within the menu for all tastes and preferences. We had the steak and fries + crab meat vermicelli dish. Both were v good. Of mention is the bun that came with the steak. Crisp on the outside and soft on the inside. Wonderful!

Vietnamese food attracts both local and tourist. No air-conditioning but it‚Äôs cool indoor at evening during April. The food is good and delicious, also value for money. The grilled chicken is a must eat item, we ordered same dish 2 evenings.

Disappointing restaurant. Looks charming and filled with tourists. But service staff is rude and rushed. Food is really mediocre. Can you imagine a dish with French fries added to prawns pancake? address: 5D ƒê. Nguy·ªÖn Si√™u, B·∫øn Ngh√©, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
100% recommended - super good value for money for the quality and immaculate service!

the meal started really strong with the complimentary amuse bouche (sea bass shisho broth, parmesan crackers and raspberry rolls), which were all delicious. this was followed by a delightful bread selection of sourdough, baguette and my favourite of the lot, the brioche, which was warm, fluffy and studded with olives!!!!! two types of butter served (chilli and normal) but nothing to write home about, but no issue cus the bread held its own!

for starters, we had the escargot and foie gras. unfortunately i felt the garlic butter for the escargots was a bit too pungent and sharp and the taste fell a bit flat. foie gras was also a tad dry

for mains, the duck breast was soft and juicy and the skin was perfectly roasted and glistening. we also had the beef wellie which slapped! altho it is not a traditional french dish, it was so good - puff pastry was buttery and flaky, the beef was tender and well seasoned, and the diced mushrooms also added another dimension to the flavour!

all in all a very good meal

I had lunch with my family of 5 here and it was incredible! My family and I have actually never had French food before, but we were feeling adventurous.

We had the mackerel as an appetizer and chose the a la carte duck breast for the entree, which was the best duck we had ever tasted. Chef Sakal explained to us how the ducks came from the Mekong Delta and how they were dry aged and roasted. The duck skin was crispy like Peking duck, but the meat was incredibly tender and juicy. It is a must-order dish. We also tried the escargot which was seasoned perfectly and very enjoyable with the garlic and sourdough bread. My boyfriend has a previous bad experience with escargot at another restaurant but the escargot at Le Corto completely changed his attitude towards the dish. Finally, we had crepes (which were lit on fire!) with coconut ice cream and a dessert box with delicious truffles and small pastries. I think it is so rare to find a restaurant that excels in both entrees and desserts, but this one did!

The ambiance of the restaurant was so cozy but also very elegant. As an American, I noticed that many French restaurants in the USA seem very pretentious and stuffy, so their cuisine is often inaccessible to many people. At Le Corto, the waitstaff and Chef Sakal treat their patrons like family while still providing a classy and high quality experience. This restaurant is truly a gem in Saigon and I would not hesitate to eat here with my family again. I would eat at any restaurant of Chef Sakal's in Vietnam!

I had a very good time there enjoying French mixed Vietnamese cuisine.
Some traditional and some with SEA elements.
Apparently the owner/chef had good relationships with several iconic Michelin chefs who had been to Le Corto as guest chefs.
The staff were friendly and helpful, food came at the right time, not too fast or slow, just one by one.
Highly recommend foie gras and baked mango with coconut ice cream.

reviews.user_review:
I've been to this restaurant twice.  Their service is excellent. The atmosphere is very nice and very clean. The food I had a mixed experience. The spring rolls were decent,  and the grilled eggplant was excellent and yummy.  However, the q Fried Rice was pretty bland and didn't really appeal to me too much.  And the tea was average as well.

overall, I would say that this place is worth another shot for me. I do think there's a lot of promise and potential here. The service is excellent, like I said before, and they also have a Michelin rating, apparently which obviously they feature prominently on their menu and outside. I think it's pretty good overall.    The prices are fair, although it may seem that it's a bit on the higher side relative to other places, but the quality of their food is on the higher side. I just need to find the dishes that taste good for me and are not bland.

This was truly an amazing experience. Together with my wife we admitted that this was the best vegetarian food we've ever tasted in our lives. The cooks are experts when it's about working with shrooms. The peanut shroom soup and the shittake tartar were truly astonishing. Everything is served in a eye-pleasing way. The service is nice and responsive. The variety of dishes is wide. The place itself is quite elegant, but the floor could be actually renovated a bit. Really great place to enjoy a special vegetarian/vegan meal while also having authentic Vietnam flavors! I recommend this place without hesitation: Outstanding food, nice dining atmosphere and great service. We thought this place was so great that we wanted to have one more meal here: When we had a layover in HCMC, we stored our luggage at the airport, took a Grab from the airport into the city, had a great dinner and went back to catch our flight home. Really good value for money!

4.5/5

I had an amazing experience at Vo Roof in Ho Chi Minh! The bar had an upper deck with open seating, where the atmosphere was much more lively and fun. reviews.user_review: Nice restaurant, a small piece of Italy in HCMC. All dishes served were delicious. Perfect steak, soups and pasta were perfect. Prices are reasonable. Authentic atmosphere of Italy with pictures of old Italy on the brick walls. Very clean and cozy. Waiters are courteous.

I just had one of the most delightful Italian dining experiences in Ho Chi Minh City! The pizza I tried was absolutely fantastic‚Äîperfectly baked with a crispy crust and a harmony of flavors that took me straight to Italy. And now, as I‚Äôm enjoying their pasta, I‚Äôm equally amazed. The taste is simply fascinating‚Äîeach bite feels like a masterpiece crafted with love and authentic Italian flair.

The ambiance is cozy, the staff is friendly, and you can feel the passion they put into every dish. If you‚Äôre craving Italian cuisine that truly impresses, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended!

Conveniently situated on a pedestrian route, this space is delightful. Here, my friends and I enjoyed a very blending dinner. In more detail, the staffs are really nice. Their demeanor, which caring about the space that we can enjoy. Everything was fantastic! I will definitely return here.

reviews.user_review:
Great spot to get snails in district 1 that's not street food.

I came here with a friend to get some good sea food and it did not disappoint. We ordered sea food foil, lemon grass clams, and vitate conchs.

Sea food foil was great to share between friends, a good amount of sea food and mushrooms in it.

Lemon grass clams were also well made, good flavor and cooked excellently. It is though a small amount.

The vitate conchs we ordered were good to me but my Viet friend said that these snails were more like french snails, so if you are not fond of those types of snails you may want to avoid these types.

Also important to mention that the prices here are very expensive for what you get compared to street food, so if you're willing to pay the price it's good but otherwise go for street food.

A great seafood spot with fresh ingredients and friendly staff. The raw oysters were my favorite, and I appreciated how the server thoughtfully prepared the perfect dipping sauce. The razor clams with tamarind sauce were excellent. I was also amazed by how the sea urchin tasted. truly a memorable experience worth recommending.

I was particularly impressed with the restaurant's location. At first, I thought it might be a bit noisy and crowded since it's in District 1, but when I arrived, I had an incredibly relaxing evening.

The food was delicious, and the space was open and airy. The dishes were uniquely flavoured, with minimal oil, well-portioned servings, and large-sized snails. The prices were reasonable for a restaurant in the city center, and the staff was polite and friendly.

reviews.user_review: Hoang‚Äôs Kitchen is one of the best Vietnamese food we‚Äôve eaten during this trip. Our server, Ruby was very attentive and addressed all our needs. Will definitely come back to Hoang‚Äôs when I visit Vietnam again‚ù§Ô∏è

Saw this place highly rated on TripAdvisor with over 6000 reviews, so thought we‚Äôd give it a shot. Food was tasty, fresh & plentiful. Daisy was our waitress, and was pleasant & helpful. The restaurant was packed on a Friday night, yet still managed to get the meals out in a timely manner.

Note, they do tend to ask you to rate them (on the spot) by scanning a QR code on your phone for their restaurant, right after your meal when paying. So probably accounts for how many actual reviews they get, & positive ones. With people feeling a tad pressured to say something nice about the food ,or the service. Not something we generally like, but as said this time, the food & service did justify a positive review.

I stumbled upon Hoang‚Äôs Kitchen and it turned out to be one of my favorite food spots in the city! I ordered the fresh rolls and the incredibly soft grilled pork with quail eggs ‚Äî both recommended by Bear, one of the friendliest and most helpful staff I‚Äôve met on my trip. The flavors were bold, fresh, and perfectly balanced. The grilled pork was melt-in-your-mouth tender, and paired with the quail eggs, it hit all the right notes.

Bear really went above and beyond to make sure I had the best experience ‚Äî from helping with the order to making great suggestions. It‚Äôs the kind of place that feels warm, local, and authentic.

Highly recommend if you‚Äôre in Saigon and craving something genuinely good and comforting!

reviews.user_review: Outstanding Vietnamese fusion restaurant.  Cozy, modern decor.  Food is prepared right in front of you.  This menu was based on colors: 9 colors represented by 9 courses. The only disappointment is that as of now there‚Äôs no wine pairing available (you can order wine by glass or bottle).

It really struck me how fresh, yet familiar, the flavours felt. There was one off-menu item: the black bread and white sauce featuring bacon,  manchego cheese, truffles and others if I can remember a few of the ingredients... That was also wipe the bowl clean delicious so the chef really knows how to use Asian and western flavours well. The service level is of a very high calibre and I didn't have to wait long between courses. This is a MUST visit in Ho Chi Minh!!! The food was beyond delicious. The presentation is phenomenal. I highly recommend this restaurant for any foodie or gourmet meal lover.

Saigon Pho 39 was a convenient dinner spot near our hotel, and we‚Äôre glad we tried it! Their pho and banh mi were delicious‚Äînot the absolute best we‚Äôve had, but still authentic and satisfying. The staff may struggle with English, but their warmth and passion for service make up for it.

HUNGER MUST HAVE

reviews.user_review:
This little gem is tucked away in a back street of very busy downtown Saigon. We made a booking from our hotel and they were waiting to greet us when we arrived. In a city this noisy, this is a haven of peace and tranquility to unwind in.
The drinks were quickly delivered while we made our food choices and they had such interesting dishes to choose from. None of us wanted a huge meal but there was something for everyone, whether you favoured red meat or seafood. The grilled prawn and pomelo salad was light but delicious. My husband loved his beef salad so much that he even ate and enjoyed the greens because of the dressing. All six of us thought it was the best food we had eaten in Vietnam and the service was excellent as well. Definitely worth a visit!

It's about a 4-minute walk from where we stayed, so come here.  The restaurant has a clean and good atmosphere, and the food is delicious.  Everything else was excellent, unfortunately my pork with rice was the only one that was too dry and tough.  Pamelo salad is one of the must-try foods. Definitely recommend when you at Saigon.

The menu is VERY long (60+ pages) but has a lot of photos which is great. The food was quite nice. We particularly enjoyed the pomelo and grilled prawns salad. Would definitely come back. Staff was nice.

reviews.user_review: The staff were lovely & friendly, & happily seated us 30mins before afternoon closing. The beef Ph√≤ was absolutely terrific, & i‚Äôve had hundreds of bowls around the world! reviews.user_review:
Parkhaus Le Lai Street is a fantastic spot to experience German cuisine right in the heart of Saigon! Located conveniently across from the park, this small but charming restaurant offers a great selection of authentic dishes paired with an impressive variety of German beers.

It was our first time trying German food, and we were pleasantly surprised‚Äîthe flavors were quite enjoyable! The quality of the food, combined with the high level of attentive service, makes this place a tremendous value.

One of the highlights is their beer buffet, available on weekends or special occasions, where you can sample different German brews at a great price.

They tried to resolve but French Fries were cold &  by the time they served German Potatoes (which were lovely), we'd obviously eaten the schnitzel to prevent that going cold too.
Nice setting, clean with great staff & excellent service;  several people eating there with no problems noted.

This is a wonderful restaurant right across from the park that specializes in German/Austrian cuisine including a large selection of German beers. I had a lentil soup and Weiner schnitzel (veal) with potato salad. All the items were fresh, delicious and generous in portion size. As someone who comes from a German (mother) and Austrian (father) background I can attest to the authenticity of my meal. The restaurant has a casual relaxed ambiance with both indoor and outdoor seating that is right across from a park. The service staff was prompt, courteous, efficient and English understanding. I highly recommend this place to those that enjoy German/Austrian food served by friendly staff in a pleasant environment.

reviews.user_review: Viet Village offers a solid dining experience with generally good-quality ingredients and flavors that are balanced‚Äînot too salty or oily. The fried vermicelli with shrimp is decent, though not particularly standout. While everything is enjoyable, nothing truly amazed us, which is why we're giving it 3.5 stars. reviews.user_review: Tasty food and very nice ambiance! Lots of options to build your bowl from and the girls serving were pleasant and well spoken. We would have liked some non-seafood options like chicken, beef or pork but the food was still very fresh and tasty. Bowls were a little small so an option to upsize would have been better. Overall though we had a great bite to eat and would recommend to anyone who enjoys a good pok√© bowl!

This was my first time visiting Poke Saigon at  Ly Tu Trong st. The restaurant is located on the second floor of an old apartment building, and even though you have to walk upstairs, the experience is definitely worth it. The space inside is beautifully designed, airy, and much more spacious compared to  Nguyen Hue st. There are both indoor and outdoor seating options, so you can choose based on your preference.

The atmosphere is clean and fresh, and the staff is incredibly friendly and attentive. One of the highlights of Poke is that it‚Äôs a healthy restaurant. The portions are carefully measured and well-balanced, which makes you feel good about what you‚Äôre eating. Everything is served with attention to detail, from presentation to portion size.

The only downside I found was that they don‚Äôt serve ice with drinks, which is something I hope they‚Äôll consider adding to the menu in the future. reviews.user_review: I had such a great experience here today, from the food to the service and atmosphere. Fresh and alive seafood is what makes this place stand out from the rest. address: 37bis ƒê. K√Ω Con, Ph∆∞·ªùng Nguy·ªÖn Th√°i B√¨nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
From the moment you step into Quince in Saigon, you're enveloped in an atmosphere of understated elegance. The **beautiful decor** strikes a perfect balance between modern sophistication and warm inviting charm. But what truly sets Quince apart, beyond its aesthetic appeal, is the captivating open kitchen concept. It's a genuine pleasure to witness the culinary artistry unfold before your eyes, watching the chefs work with precision and passion, transforming fresh ingredients into exquisite dishes. This transparency adds a layer of entertainment and trust to the dining experience.

And speaking of exquisite dishes, the food at Quince is nothing short of **exceptional**. Every plate is a testament to the quality of ingredients and the skill of the kitchen team. It's easy to see why they've earned a well-deserved Michelin mention.During my visit, the bone marrow stood out as an absolute highlight ‚Äì rich, flavorful, and utterly decadent. Similarly, the steak was cooked to perfection, boasting a beautiful sear and tender, juicy interior.

To elevate the meal further, Quince boasts a  vast and thoughtfully curated wine selection. Our server offered excellent recommendations, and the chosen glass paired flawlessly with both the bone marrow and the steak, creating a truly harmonious culinary experience.

Just when you think the meal couldn't get any better, Quince surprises you with a delightful candy box treat at the end. It's a whimsical and playful touch that leaves a lasting positive impression.

Overall, my experience at Quince was truly memorable. The beautiful ambiance, the captivating open kitchen, the exceptional food and drinks, and the thoughtful finishing touches all contribute to a dining experience that is both sophisticated and thoroughly enjoyable. If you're looking for a special meal in Saigon, Quince is an absolute must-visit. I wholeheartedly recommend it and can certainly see why it has garnered such well-deserved recognition.

- Restaurant: Not too spacious. Open kitchen. Primarily black decor.
- Service: Polite and attentive.
- Drinks: ordinary.
- Food: Quite delicious. Beautifully presented.
- Price: Quite high compared to the general level.
The fine dining experience was quite good. The service was polite and attentive. The food took a bit long to come out, perhaps because the restaurant was quite crowded that day. And there were some customers celebrated the birthday anniversaries at the restaurant that day.

Some culinary experiences are simply unforgettable. Quince was one of them. The moment I took a bite of their foie gras parfait (first photo) was when I started dreaming about my next visits here. Every dish was exquisite -- no flavors are wasted, they're all meticulously curated. Healthy portion so come hungry. If there's only two of you I highly recommend getting the bar seat to complement your meal watching the chefs in the zone. A beautiful experience in Saigon -- the only down side was that I was too full to try more dishes. A special mention to Harry for his top notch service.

Let‚Äôs start by saying I ate here 4 times whilst visiting HCMC. The pho is very good, as well as some of the other foods. Our server was probably a manager there who was quite pushy - she recommended expensive dishes to us on purpose, for example, recommending us a hotpot that doubles the price of all the other ones.

Continuing with that, dish prices are ridiculously considering its location and most guests that this place were targeted for. We spent around 2,000k vnd (~$80) for 6 people, and it might not sound like a lot - but considering the restaurant‚Äôs location, quality, and targeted customers - very expensive. One dish I would not recommend is the b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc. They claimed to use Australian beef - named ‚ÄúHokubee‚Äù - apparently, but it was very fatty and not in good quality. This dish was almost 400k (~ $15), and I was concerned of how expensive it was because you can get a b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc dish at a way fancier restaurant for half the price - i‚Äôm talking about Ho√†ng Y·∫øn Restaurant. The manager tried to justify for it but honestly, it‚Äôs too expensive. Also some dishes took very very long to come up that we had to cancel it. It was a grilled chicken one, i think, and after waiting for 20 minutes, we asked them and they said that they were grilling it and will come up soon. 15 minutes later, nothing. So they lied, and we canceled it.

Overall, the food isn‚Äôt terrible, except for the b√≤ l√∫c l·∫Øc, but very expensive with unprofessional service. I‚Äôve dined here multiple times in the past and honestly would not come back again now.

reviews.user_review: Went for lunch on a weekday. It was busy, but I was seated quickly. The staff are helpful. It's a restaurant that caters to tourists, with tourist prices and strong aircon. The menu has pictures and English descriptions. I ordered the special set. It arrived quickly. The meat pieces were tasty. The spring roll was thick and crunchy, but not particularly flavorful. The noodles with the sauce were very good. The leftover sauce was great, I drank it all. Paid with a card.

Today, I visited Qu√°n Ngon - B√∫n Ch·∫£ H√† N·ªôi with friends. This humble eatery is tucked away in a side street near the entrance to Ph·ªë ƒêi B·ªô B√πi Vi·ªán. Despite its central location in a popular tourist hotspot, the prices are very reasonable. For a special menu, which included a spring roll, the cost was under 100,000 VND. I also ordered some extra meat.

The restaurant offers air-conditioned seating, making it a comfortable escape from the heat. The food was delicious‚Äîthe meat was perfectly grilled, and the broth was rich and flavorful. Overall, a great dining experience!

I have always wanted to sample more bun cha dishes in HCMC after tasting a good one in my recent travel. A quick search online led me to this place with what seemed to be a solid rating. The menu here was simple as they only offer bun cha in few variations. I went for the special one which came with a fried spring roll. If you enjoy a lighter and less intense bun cha dipping sauce then this may be up your alley. I thought the sauce was not as rich and strong in flavors compared to the one I tasted few days ago. Nonetheless, it was not devoid of taste by any means and yhat simply meant that one can enjoy more of the dipping sauce since it will be lighter on your palate. The grilled pork were nicely prepared with delicious smoky flavors. The minced pork patties was decent but again, my previous bun cha patties were on another level. The rice noodles were average and the fried spring roll was a hearty addition to your bun cha. Having said all that, I personally felt that the bun cha here was decent albeit lacking the intense flavors which I was looking for.

reviews.user_review: Great food to be had! It‚Äôs has lovely garden setting as well. You get the authentic feel but with high quality refined food. The menu is dominated by a great selection of vegetable dishes on offer. Highly recommend coming and trying out. The soft shell crab was spot on, the mango salad was excellent as well. Shout out to the fried rice which was a great accompaniment to the salad. The prices were pretty affordable as well for the type of place.

We were craving rice and home cooking after our trip to Bangkok so we decided to give this place a try.

Food is actually pretty good but extremely overpriced for what it is.

Everything was cooked to perfection and seasoned very nicely. The tofu and fried fish were probably my favourites of the night but everything was pretty tasty.

Portion is nice.. Manageable size even for couples. If you come with your family or friends, you can order a few more dishes to share. Generally, the food is not spicy and very delicious.
Salad is a great start, for a lighter food, fried tofu is yummy! Love the soup they recommended us. Was a little worried that it's catfish (usually has a muddy taste, but this doesn't have it). I would recommend the stew pork, too. Reminds me of home (bak kuh teh).
Green mango juice is pretty unique too (taste like balong long drink). I enjoyed my lotus tea!
Great service, too. The servers are very attentive. Every now and then, they will check on us.

I often come here to eat because it's close to home. I find every dish delicious, my favorite is corn ramen with vermicelli and fish sauce. The space is about 6-8 tables, but still clean and airy. Will still support the shop.

Food:
Okay, spring rolls are ok, served hot and crispy, the fish sauce is sweet, not salty like the Quang region, probably adjusted to suit the taste of the South, easy to sell. The banh xeo was cold and chewy, not freshly made, the banh beo was also cold, who in the world would sell cold banh beo to customers like that.
Service:
Staff attitude, I went to eat with colleagues and everyone felt the attitude of the staff when my table asked for more vegetables and fish sauce. While there were 3 of us, ordered 3 spring rolls, but only 1 plate of vegetables, 2 bowls of fish sauce, and the small bowl of fish sauce was the size of a banh beo bowl. From the moment I asked for more, the staff brought the food out and put it on the table very rudely, for example, if I was too sensitive, I wouldn't say anything, but everyone at the table felt his attitude.

The food here is absolutely fantastic! I ordered the ganh cua dong small with banh bot loc, paired with a refreshing oolong tea, and everything was bursting with flavor. The ganh cua dong had a rich, authentic taste that transported me straight to Vietnam, and the banh bot loc was perfectly chewy and savory. Every bite felt like a celebration of traditional flavors done right. The oolong tea was the perfect complement, with its subtle aroma and calming finish rounding out the meal beautifully.

What truly elevated the experience was the exceptional service. The staff were attentive, friendly, and ensured that every detail was taken care of, making the meal even more enjoyable. It‚Äôs rare to find a place where both the food and the service are equally impressive, but this restaurant hits all the right notes. I can‚Äôt wait to return and explore more of their menu‚Äîhighly recommend for anyone looking for a memorable dining experience!

reviews.user_review: Proper Vietnamese home cooking. I ordered the thit heo kho tieu (braised pork with pepper)  and the simmered chicken with ginger. Could not fault either of them. The pork was meltingly tender, savory and slightly sweet, with a robust flavor profile due to the fish sauce, sugar, and black pepper. It has a warm spiciness that adds depth without overwhelming the palate. The chicken fell off the bone served with an awesome smelling gingery broth which flavoured the rice perfectly. Could not ask for a better meal. 2 dishes, rice and a drink, 180k
Had lunch with my family. The taste of the food is OK but when I have my dish, I saw a rubber band in the food. Lost my appetite üòí

As soon as I saw the restaurant, I was skeptical. The atmosphere was too "cute" by half and therefore, I was worried about the "lowest common denominator" effect that touristy places sometimes have (serve the bare minimum because tourist don't know better). And I was right.

We had to peel the wait staff from their phones for every little request. The food was OK, but when I asked for more noodles for my mi quang (a common request in any restaurant that it is usually on the menu as an a la carte add-on and my bowl was sorely lacking in noodles), we were given a long winded excuse (in Vietnamese to my Viet wife) about how that was impossible to get extra noodles unless I ordered an entire additional mi quang. This is a common 'screw the tourist' play, but I've been here 18 years and it pissed me right off.

The first picture is my bowl of mi quang AFTER my wife gave me all her noodles (she took all my chicken (second picture)).

So in summation, a shame as it could be a "cute" place to go or take friends, the flavor was fine, but the staff and the 'nickel and dime' routine was off-putting. Won;t go back.

reviews.user_review: This restaurant serves traditional Northern Vietnamese Food! Being a tourist, I was quite impressed with the huge paintings on the wall and the decoration is very lovely, not forgetting to mention the server is friendly too! Food portion was huge and suitable for family or team dining. Presentation is in traditional way and tasted as good as per our expectation. Good dining experience and walking distance to the centre of District1 at HCMC.

We enjoyed our meal here. The place gives us an authentic vibes of Northern Vietnam. Though it‚Äôs a bit costly, the foods are worth the money. Every dish we had was really tasty and the portions are big enough to share. The ‚Äúcha ca la vong‚Äù was so good and the tofu in scallion oil is highly recommended. The staff are attentive, accommodating and polite. The best part is the ambiance and comfortable seats. The menu also offers a wide variety of sumptuous local Northern cuisines to choose from. The drinks menu includes healthy options. The only reason for 4 stars is hoping to have smaller portions for affordable options later on. We‚Äôll be back!

Ann Quan in Ho Chi Minh City is a hidden gem that brings together refined Vietnamese flavors with an elegant, modern atmosphere. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with warm hospitality and attentive service, making us feel truly welcome. The ambiance is both cozy and sophisticated, with beautiful decor that highlights Vietnam's rich culture in a contemporary way. A must-visit for anyone in Ho Chi Minh City looking to enjoy authentic Northern Vietnamese food with a modern twist in a delightful setting. Highly recommended for both locals and tourists!

reviews.user_review:
This is a small and charming restaurant serving delightful Vietnamese food. The setting and ambience are pleasant and inviting.

The coconut fried rice has a lovely hint of coconut flavor and is well-prepared. The beef skewers are soft and tender, while the crispy pork pairs nicely with the flavorful sesame sauce. However, the pork knuckle was rather ordinary and did not meet expectations.

Overall, the presentation of the dishes and the restaurant‚Äôs setting are very nice. It‚Äôs a good spot for a casual and satisfying meal.

This was the best tasting food that I've eaten at during my trip to Vietnam.  I liked it so much that I came back 2 other times, and brought a friend the second time.  My first experience at this place, I ordered the Beef Skewers with Rice Vermicelli and an order Fried Spring Rolls and Pickled Plum Juice.  These were all recommended by my waiter, and I gave everything a 10/10, and the portions were huge and I completely devoured it.  The second time I ordered the recommended Stir-Fried Beef Fillet with Beef Sauce and Vegetable and Salted Lemon Drink and didn't like it as much, as it didn't taste as good and the portion was a lot smaller.  The waiter also forgot the Spring rolls we ordered.  The place seems to have a lot of foreigners (which is often a red flag for me), and it does seem a bit commercial (it is a franchise), so I questioned its authenticity as Vietnamese cuisine.  However, despite all this, I still highly recommend this place as it's still my go-to when I want a full hearty and tasty meal that seems reasonably authentic.  It also seems like a good place to bring a date.

The service was fast. Although poor signal for card payment but the servers were always smiling and polite.

Food was served fast and hot. We love the skewers and pancakes. Really filling to the tummy. The servings were really good for sharing.

The ambiance is very soothing to the mood.

reviews.user_review: The eatery might have the largest number of customers in the area. However, they also have a large staff so the service is remarkably quick. For an additional cost, seaweed or bitter gourd soup can be ordered, with a single bowl being sufficient for two people. reviews.user_review:
Li Bai Dimsum Restaurant inside the Sheraton Hotel is a true gem for anyone who loves authentic, high-quality Chinese cuisine. From the moment you step inside, you‚Äôre welcomed by an elegant and relaxing atmosphere that perfectly complements the dining experience.

The dim sum here is outstanding ‚Äî each dish is carefully crafted, beautifully presented, and full of authentic flavors. Whether it was the tender har gow, the crispy spring rolls, or the rich and savory siu mai, every bite was a delight. The menu offers a wide variety, so there's something for everyone to enjoy.

What truly made the experience unforgettable was the exceptional service from our waitress, Ti√™n. She was incredibly welcoming, knowledgeable, and attentive throughout our meal. Ti√™n not only made excellent recommendations from the menu but also took the time to explain each dish and ensure we were completely satisfied. Her warm personality and genuine care for guests elevated our dining experience to another level.

It‚Äôs rare to encounter service that feels both highly professional and sincerely personal, but Ti√™n delivered that perfectly. She made us feel like valued guests rather than just another table.

If you‚Äôre staying at the Sheraton or simply looking for an extraordinary dim sum experience, Li Bai is a must-visit. And if you're lucky enough to have Ti√™n as your server, you're in for an even more memorable meal.

Highly recommended for both the incredible food and truly outstanding service.

I absolutely love this place! They are very popular and their business is driving to the point where they have four units side by side for their one restaurant on a main street. You can't afford that unless your food and service are excellent! The food is great and the atmosphere is pretty good. But what is the most kindness and hospitality with the owner and staff has bestowed upon me. My family came here to eat the special crab udon noodles soup. After the meal, I was stranded alone and couldn't book a ride because it was raining during rush hours. The owner recognized the distress expression on my face and had one of her waiters drive me back to my hotel. ü•∞
The next day I came back to try a different dish, crab rice noodle soup, which was also very good, the owner, √öt L·ªá, again offered me a ride back to the hotel. But I told her it wasn't necessary because I was actually on my way to somewhere else. But I really appreciate her generosity and hospitality. When she heard that, she had her husband, Qu√¢n, drive me to my next destination. I said it wasn't necessary but insisted on helping me. ü•∞
Their generosity is enough for me to recommend this place. But I recommend this place for everything: the service, food and hospitality!

The restaurant is spacious, the prices are reasonable, the service is quick and polite, the crab noodle soup is okay but the bagel twists have oily smell (it made me feel that cooking oil was reused many times), there is free parking for motorbikes.

A local friend of mine told me about this place. Their main dish is crab noodle soup, must try! I've had this same dish at home in Melbourne Australia (only 1 place makes it). The noodle soup here is more delicious, the fish cakes, the bread dipping and quail eggs all add extra flavour to the dish. The only thing lacking is the crab meat but you expect this when you're only paying $60000 VND($4AUD). The price I paid in Australia was $29 aud(it does have more crabs). The place is packed with locals and I will return to order more. Fantastic!

+Space: The restaurant is clean but the space is small, the restaurant only has a fan so eating in the early morning is a bit hot. I don't like the restaurant's music very much. Both times I went out to eat and listened to the music, it was so boring, did it affect my experience?
+Staff: Enthusiastic and cute, but it's a bit crowded and the restaurant seems messy and not very professional
+Food: The first time I ate on the opening day of vermicelli along the mosquito net, that day my nose was stuffy but I felt the broth was light and the meat was rich but not very impressive. reviews.user_review: Excellent local restaurant. Have wanted to come here since seeing it on a travel show ‚ÄòSomeone Feed Phil‚Äô. Happy salad is definitely a must as is the Cajun style shrimps. The fried rice dish with beef was also great but the best was the fried tofu - just superb, couldn‚Äôt get enough of it. We had heard great things about this restaurant and we were so impressed!
After reading that dinner gets super busy with the locals, we decided to have lunch here instead. We would recommend this option as we had our pick of the tables and the food came out really quickly.
We ordered the chef signature dishes of Happy Salad which contained beef, garlic, pineapple, Vietnamese eggplant, kumquat, mint, lemongrass, passionfruit dressing and sesame seeds and the Cajun Shrimps with Garlic Butter Sauce plus also the Mexico Wonton to share.
All the dishes were outstanding, leaving us with satisfied smiles on our faces due to just how delicious they were!
The staff were really friendly in spite of there sometimes being a language barrier on both sides but the menu is in English and Vietnamese so you can point to the dishes you want to order.
This restaurant was without a doubt one of our favourites in Vietnam (and we visited a lot!) so just make sure you visit with an empty stomach!

This DIY platter comprises of my top choices for meat: Bo La Lot. It actually taste quite special. Unique flavour. I was told that the 'dog' meat is prepared using a type of fermented germ which is usually used for the preparation of real dog meat.

Give it a try for an out of the norm food. I'm sure you will find it interesting.

I was invited here for dinner. Thought the food should taste like authentic in Ha Noi but turned out wrong. The only thing was decent was the soup. Beside that, the fishes that were cooked in the clay pot was reheated so may times it was chewy and sour. The grilled fishes with dill were too much fat on the fish so it tasted like eating pork fat. Sorry that I sounded like I‚Äôm over exaggerated but really nothing in the shop tasted like the original recipes in the northern of Vietnam.

reviews.user_review: This restaurant was recommended by my Vietnamese friend. As a Filipino, I found some of the dishes pleasantly familiar, which made the experience feel like home. The staff were kind and accommodating, even giving us an extra serving of banana ice cream for dessert (though I forgot the name). I‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

Bui Bistro is a delightful dining destination that truly showcases the richness of Vietnamese cuisine. The variety of dishes on their menu is impressive, offering everything from classic pho to vibrant banh mi and delectable spring rolls. Each dish is crafted with authentic ingredients, ensuring an unforgettable culinary experience.

What sets Bui Bistro apart is not just the food, but also the quick and friendly support from the staff. They are always eager to help, providing recommendations and ensuring that each guest feels welcome and valued. This attention to service enhances the overall dining experience.

Additionally, the decor of Bui Bistro beautifully reflects Vietnamese culture, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere. The thoughtful design elements and cozy seating make it an ideal spot for both casual meals and special occasions. Overall, Bui Bistro is a fantastic place to enjoy delicious Vietnamese food in a friendly and aesthetically pleasing environment!

Nested in a nice village, a cozy corner in Saigon Pearl with the vibe of authentic Vietnamese home kitchen design, you will like this environment amongst the concrete buildings. The Foods here very nice, I like the authentic taste & fresh ingredients. My most fav is any dish here related to ‚Äúm·∫Øm n√™m/fermented fish shrimp sauce‚Äù. Highly reco. Huy - manager here is always smiling & client-service oriented.

reviews.user_review:
A tiny hole in the place very close to Saigon Center shopping mall.

Fabulous food, service and ambience.

The entrance was a bit hard to find, we walked down a really long dark alley that looked like a passageway for locals before we spotted the restaurant tucked away around the corner.

They have Saigon local dishes, loads of choices of Vietnamese dishes and even a massive vegetarian menu. üëçüèºüëçüèº

Our waiter, Kai, was incredibly friendly, he explained all the dishes (this is our 3rd week in Vietnam, so we already knew how to eat most of what we had ordered) but we loved the personal touch. Thanks for making us feel special.

I definitely recommend eating here, you won't be disappointed.

I think they have another location in HCMC as well.

Great place!!!! The food was amazing. The staff was very polite and helpful. Kim the waitress that served as has excellent, very polite and assist us by explaining the dishes and even show us how to eat some of them.  It's a little bit difficult to find the restaurant, there is an alley between two clubs (you will noticed parked motorcycle inside the alley) at the end of the alley go left and you will see the entrance.

What an awesome restaurant, while we were walking around this area‚Äôs restaurant, we suddenly got hungry and started looking at google maps reviews, this one instantaneously caught our eyes for their reviews and 4.9 star rating. After coming here it didn‚Äôt disappoint at all! We ate the food that I have uploaded in my reviews and it was absolute stunning, delicious and ate it pretty fast! Lyly was of great assistant as well, we appreciate her help recommending dishes. Truly recommendedüòä

reviews.user_review: Beautiful ambience and relaxed place. Putan was our waiter and he was very gentle and explained to us about the food. Had very delicious pork fresh spring rolls, beef in bamboo and chicken crispy fingers all fresh and delicious. The food was fragrant and not overly seasoned and cooked to perfection. The beef especially cooked very tenderly and delicious. 100% recommend, will come back again in the future.

Food was probably the best we had while we were in Vietnam! It was all so fresh and tasty. The staff were lovely and friendly and also spoke amazing English. I had the chicken pho which was unreal. Other people had the stir fried noodles as well as the sweet and sour chicken, which were super delicious. We also had a few cocktails which were so nice a refreshing. Would definitely recommend!

Just landed in Ho Chi Minh City and was looking for dinner nearby my hotel and Tung‚Äôs Restaurant is at the top recommendation.

I looked at the menu and it didn‚Äôt take long for me to decide. I tried their Hanoi traditional fried pork, at first I wanted to eat with white rice but the server told me that it comes with rice noodle and asked if I wanted to try first, I will be shown how to make the roll.

The taste was superb, the portion is satisfying, and I really love the ambience & the dining experience guided by local, all thanks to Uyen Tran for the superb service!

reviews.user_review: The best goat I‚Äôve had in Vietnam. Service to match. Lovely atmosphere, beautifully clean bathrooms. Owner took care of us, overall a fantastic experience for my birthday.

Pretty good bbq. The beef was very tasty but the pork not so much. Lots of space. Seemed like most customers go here to drink M·ªôt, Hai, Ba, Dzo! We sat in the back area which has 2-3 good sized rats scurrying around which definitely made the experience less appetizing.

This is not the old traditional bbq restaurant before Covid-19. Now it is towards Japanese concept with seafood and a, variety of dishes not related to bbq. The seashells here taste bad. The bbq meat still good.

address: 180-188 L√Ω T·ª± Tr·ªçng, Ph∆∞·ªùng B·∫øn Th√†nh, Qu·∫≠n 1, H·ªì Ch√≠ Minh 700000, Vietnam

reviews.user_review:
Me and my partner are always on the lookout for great dining experience and curated menus when we travel. It is very rare that we will find a restaurant that would have the food on point from start to finish. Normally we will find something that would be average for our tasts‚Ä¶but NOT CLOUD NINE SAIGON!!!

From the entree to the dessert and the mocktail shots - this restaurant delivered! The food is not the only thing to rave about. The ambience, lighting, and service were all 5-star!

Special thanks to Nguyen for attending to us, and we cannot praise the chef and their team in the kitchen for the outstanding dishes served to us!

Highly recommended and I would not be surprised if they end up in michelin guide in the future.

It is one of the best dining experiences! I reserved a very nice table with a nice view.  The food was delicious.  Anhle was my server, and he was very attentive and pleasant.  He loves his job, and it shows. The food presentation is exceptional.  I loved everything from the pepper grinder presentation to the baked Alaska dessert. I would visit again.

The only thing I didn't like was the music selection.  It was too dramatic and opera style. Not appropriatefor the setting. I want to relax and not be rushed,  not hear this bellowing music.  I did mention it because it was too much.  I think they either turned off a speaker or turned it down.  Later, the music selection changed.

Overall,  it was a great experience and delicious.

My colleagues and I spent the week in south Vietnam and decided to have a nice farewell dinner. We chose Cloud Nine and were so glad we did. The food was amazing, some of the best I have ever had. The presentation was equally as wonderful. The service of the staff was an A+ and the view of the city was great. I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting HCMC.  Bravo!

reviews.user_review: I arrived at the restaurant in the middle of the day amidst the outside heat. The boss welcomed me with a smiling face and found a seat for me. She asked about my order and offered some suggestions. I decided to order the Bun Rieu. The food was satisfactory, and it was reasonably priced.

Vermicelli soup is okay. No crab or meat. Probably because I ate late at night. But the price of 40k for a bowl of vermicelli soup without meat and crab is not very reasonable. The shop looks clean and hygienic.

Tao Ngo restaurant stands out with its chicken hotpot with √© leaves, providing an unforgettable culinary experience. The hotpot broth is simmered from chicken bones, with a sweet taste and strong aroma of √© leaves. reviews.user_review: I ordered late at night. It was not delicious. It tastes like dog food.

The rice was normal, the thinly sliced cucumber had been left for a long time so it was a bit wilted, the thick meat had not been marinated so it was not delicious, hard, the egg rolls were hard. Delicious sour soup

I rate 2 stars because today's food was okay. The ribs were marinated in just the right amount of candied fish sauce as expected. But the staff attitude is VERY VERY BAD. Entering the shop, there was no employee to take orders. When I went to the counter to order, the staff ordered wrongly. There was also no apology to the customer. I ordered 1/3 of just egg rolls because as soon as I walked in, I saw the newspaper saying it was about to start baking. When ordering, I was told to wait 15 minutes. But after waiting for 10 minutes, the staff at the food counter called out to the waiter that they were out of pork belly and had to deal quickly so they could order to take away. That friend also came in and reported that the pork belly was out of stock while I had agreed to wait to eat that dish. When I didn't want to change it, I asked for the order again (even though I had already ordered pork belly and egg rolls) and then still served 1/3 portion as usual. From the moment I entered the restaurant, I did not understand the way the restaurant staff operated, but even if I made a mistake with the order or informed the customer of such a change, there was no apology or explanation. Even though there are only 3 tables in the restaurant, there are a total of 4 employees. When the rice is almost finished, the next dish is brought out. A very bad experience. In the picture is my plate. My brother's egg rolls came with me.

reviews.user_review:
B·∫øp Me In is on the Michelin Guide when I visited in Feb 2025. My own mark if a food is good, you have to try their local home styled cooking. Hence the pork stew, morning glory and the soup would give me an indication if the place is legit.

I am, by no means, a Vietnamese connoisseur on Vietnamese food but all the dishes certainly went well with my palate.

The food was certainly up to mark and the coconut fried rice was on another level! A flavourful and well textured concoction! Worth every Dong you have left!

The service staff were attentive and really eager to serve.

I would recommend this to my own family and friends. It is off the Main Street and getting there is an experience itself!

Really good food. There were so many good options on the menu I‚Äôd have to come back 5-6 times just to do a review justice! With my one visit I can tell you the food is excellently cooked, authentic, appropriately priced and offered with good service. The snacks and meat plates are decidedly better than the noodle based dishes but I‚Äôm splitting hairs.
Nice fresh food, although we ordered heaps it was quite a light feeling meal. Loved all the herbs and veggies with the meals. Super cold beer and fantastic service!
